# The Global Values Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This group contains functions that operate on global values. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This group contains functions that operate on global values.

Functions in this group relate to functions in the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">llvm::GlobalValue</a> class tree.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/globalvalue">llvm::GlobalValue</a>
</SectionUser>

<SectionDefinition>

### LLVMGlobalCopyAllMetadata() {#gaf45cc37326ba53d1488a99a9bd0012ec}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueMetadataEntry &#42; LLVMGlobalCopyAllMetadata (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Value, size&#95;t &#42; NumEntries)</>}>
Retrieves an array of metadata entries representing the metadata attached to this value.

The caller is responsible for freeing this array by calling <code>LLVMDisposeValueMetadataEntries</code>.


<SectionUser title="See Also">

### LLVMGlobalGetValueType() {#ga67eb1005ab6e286927090875eefb4e5d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMTypeRef LLVMGlobalGetValueType (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Global)</>}>
Returns the &quot;value type&quot; of a global value.

This differs from the formal type of a global value which is always a pointer type.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
